Eggington's eclectic looking menu, but the variety offered really isn't as extensive as it first appears, service was average at best and the pricing is pretty extreme for what equates to Waffle House quality food with an extra helping of mushrooms and hollandaise sauce thrown on top. Basic entrees and orange juice for 2 individuals = $26...before tip! That's certainly an expensive way to start your day!

The atmosphere makes it a great place to take family visiting from out of town, which I plan to do, but the price makes it hard to justify as a regular breakfast stop. You can get equivalent food at other local establishments for half the price.

This is amongst the best breakfast place in the valley. My wife and I try to make it every month and try get  something different on the menu.  I never succeed and get the piglet passion with a side of Bacon.  Wife always gets fruit which is always fresh and a side eggs and english muffin.  We have never had a bad experience there.  I would like to suggest some flavored coffee creamer or stronger coffee

Oh yes I love this place...outdoor seating and indoor, right off the 60 and has my favorite omelette ever... the European? maybe.... it had Swiss cheese, chives, bacon.  Can't wait to visit here again. Gets a little packed on weekends for breakfast.

This place is cute, however lacking on flavor. The skillet I had was plain when I was expecting it to be bursting with flavor due to everything having a lot of peppers and spices in their menu description. The tortilla was also lacking and did not taste very authentic, more like store bought. The coffee was very weak, the OJ was decent but expensive and it tasted like Simply Orange (not necessarily a bad thing, but I was expecting something fresher). The best part of the meal was the Foster's French toast, albeit on the sweet side it was very nice of them to split it as it was being shared.

This is probably the best breakfast place in the east valley. Athough we are new to the area, we have dined here several times before and have always come away with high praise. All the omelets are excellent and the pumpkin pancakes are yummy.  They do take reservations so if you want to avoid the long wait... 30 minutes or more on weekends, do call ahead.
Meh. Perhaps eggs and potatoes were the wrong thing to get. Didn't know you could mess that up... Just not great. The English muffin was fantastic though.

On a weekend the host lost our name on the his scratchpad, that was supposed to be the waiting list. Empty coffee canisters while we waited 30 min. I finally asked when we would be seated. He flipped FOUR pages forward on his scratchepad and said he could seat us now. When we ordered I was appalled the crab Benedict was made with surmi  (artificial crab). It was only just warm and the meat was abundant and disgusting. I want everything about that brunch back.

The food is fantastic, the only reason i detract a star is for ambiance. it's all down home, country themed (country as in floral curtains, not music). and it's popular with the over 50 crowd.... so, not my breakfast joint of choice on that per say, but the food is rad.

the other day i had what i can only compare to eggs benedict, except instead of an english muffin it was a puff pastry, and instead of ham there was crab meat. whoa, that was intense...delicious, but intense.

i love that when you order ice tea or water, they bring the whole carafe so you can refill at your own pace.

i can't help but feel a twang of sympathy for those poor waitresses in the golf shirts, pleated khaki shorts and loafers... it's kind of cute, but really just sort of unflattering and dorky - but not cute dorky. and my mom swears one of the waitresses had a black eye -- very off-putting when she's rocking dockers and socks with loafers...

This is a very cute breakfast place in Mesa AZ in a strip mall.  Get there early on a weekend or you will be waiting. 

Nice menu but pricey.  I felt $3.50 for a very small orange juice was a bit much.  I should have paid $5 to get the mimosa.  The food was good. My blueberry pancake was enormous and came with this blueberry compote that was warm and so delicious.  They also brought a pitcher of syrup.

My server was just average.  The place was kind of loud and tables are close together too. I was sitting at a table for two and it was just me.  My two plates about filled the table since they put my eggs/fruit on one plate and the pancake on another. 

I might go back but probably not this trip.

I've been coming here every week for over 2 years and it's honestly one of my favorite breakfast spots in the South Tempe/Mesa area. They have amazing customer service and bomb.com breakfasts. Highly recommend the O'Pear Omelette, Chipotle Breakfast Burrito, and the Breakfast Salad (which is actually a delicious, gargantuan parfait). T.C. Eggington's does get busy on holidays, so be sure to get there before the breakfast rush!!!

Solid brunch spot. First Benedict that came out was overdone but he manager promptly ordered me a new one and let me pick at the first plate in the meantime. Potatoes were good second Benedict round was money. Mimosa was pricey though not sure why. More than half the cost of a plate. Great service also!
Excellent,  it's been 17 years since I have been here and always had great memories and they still are rocking the breakfast menu! Great friendly service, nice farm decor, unique omelets.

Yummmmmm I love breakfast and I loved my eggs Benedict. Only downside was my minuscule side dish of home fries and fruit was about 5 pieces hidden under my plate dressing of leafy veggies for decor. We called in for reservations (or to be on the wait list) and got there and was seated right away. They could do themselves a solid by expanding their space too.

My friend brought me here when I was visiting Phoenix as she explained this was her favorite breakfast place in the city.

The place is decorated like a country farmhouse with floral wallpaper, pictures of farmers and spoons and whisks hanging from the wall. Our servers were friendly but young. I swear everyone who worked here was 16 or younger.

I ordered an omelet that had cheese and pear and bacon. It was delicious and one of the best omelets I've ever had. I was blown away by just how sophisticated the food was for a place that seems very quaint.

I would love to come back here the next time I'm in Phoenix.

The best part was the menu that explained the weird and wonderful Eggington family. You need to go here just for the charming menu.

After reading the excellent reviews of T.C. Eggingtons, I saw "The Benedict sauce is amazing" so I had to stop. The table setting is enchanting; there is a carafe of ice cold water waiting for you, and the glassware was decorative and contained two daisies, which reminded me of the finer restaurants in Spain and France.

The waitress was sweet and extremely helpful. I loved her service and demeanor. 

I ordered the Eggs Benedict and it was very good. The sauce was as advertised: creamy, lemony, and just rich enough to make it luscious. The potatoes are slightly crispy and soft in the middle. Everything was seasoned perfectly.

So why the three star review instead of 4 or 5? I ordered the griddle cakes. They were enormous, a little battery, and looked delicious. After taking a few bites, sadly I found a hair in my food. The manager was very helpful and gracious and helped me with offering another order or removing it from my order.

Still, I would give this restaurant another shot. What I got to eat was very very good.
Excellent food and service. This place had me smiling all the way home. Great job. Also the fresh squeezed juice is recommended. I haven't found a better option for the price. Great atmosphere.

I went here to meet some friends from out of state.

I ordered the Red Hot Mama plate which consist of eggs, jalapenos, chorizo and something else( I don't remember).

I got it because I was in the mood for spicy. This one was NOT spicy. It had flavor but no "kick". Disappointed.

Friends from out of state didn't seem thrilled about it either.  

Also, the coffee was weak. Really weak!

This is the second time going here and left feeling unsatisfied.

At least we got to catch up with friends.
Delicious breakfast! The orange juice is great. Also the foster's french was awesome. Great service and overall good!

So, I feel like they had some service problems with seating folks - but  I'm going to put them aside and mostly review them on the solid food here.  

Really cute country decor inside and it's a pretty large place.  We called ahead and we were told there was no wait but put our names on what we thought was a call ahead list.  At least that's what the guy on the phone told us...
So we got there and we had a few people ahead of us.  It seemed that even though we called ahead for a 10:00am table we needed to wait.  Okay, no biggie.  But then more people started coming and the one guy manning the front desk seemed to get completely overwhelmed.  We waited a little longer than we expected to wait - but were finally seated at a table in their back room.

Really wanted to try their special raspberry chocolate mocha but was told that their machine had not been functioning.  Bummer. 

The cinnamon apple jam was really delicious.  Almost bought a jar it was so good!  I would come back just for that stuff! 

I ordered the O'Pear Grenache Omelette and it was really tasty!  Enjoyed the potatos, too!  

My kiddo ordered the pancakes and we were really impressed by the very large pancake that arrived.  She very much enjoyed it, too!
Giant portions of really good food. Excellent service. The french toast was so good I dreamt about it afterwards!

Went on a Friday afternoon and had the "Natie Bomb".  This was THE BEST sandwich I have ever had!  My wife had pancakes; which were absolutely amazing, as well.  I almost ordered another one to go.  If you plan on going on a weekend morning, you're going to be waiting for about 45 minutes.  It's the best breakfast in town!
I just wish I could give this place 6 stars...

Ok... Breakfast is my thing. I don't like frills and weird stuff. I ordered something they call "Plain and Simple". Easy enough... Eggs, bacon and potatoes. I guess I confused them, I ordered an extra egg. I asked for the three eggs "over medium". Which the world over means the whites done and the yolks not. These were cooked over hard (hard whites and yokes). That wasn't all... The potatoes were cottage style and they put Lawry's seasoning on them. Sorry, I won't be back

It's always busy. The food is fabulous. I find I eat slower and enjoy the time when there. I like the choices and capabilities to work with my diet. I've taken many friend's here and we'll continue. It's one of my top fav breakfast restaurants.

Called on a Sunday morning and they were able to hold a table for our large group.  Server was so quick & efficient !! Food was great. Large portions so plan to take home leftovers.  Ordered the cottage omelet. Delicious !!! Loved that there was Sooo much crab in the omelet. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu

The boyfriend and I went here on a Sunday morning hung over from Four Lokos. 

The food was fucking great and I don't even like breakfast food.  I got this egg and jalapeno burrito thing with this sort of runny but generally pretty tasty salsa and I wanted to shower in the burrito filling.  I would have bathed in eggs and salsa if only to prolong my experience with this semi-breakfast burrito thing.  I would have married it and had kids with it and bought a house in Michigan nearby a really good school district.  I fell in love with the egg jalapeno burrito thing, I would cuddle with it on weekday mornings and plan trips to national parks with it.  

It was also nice sitting on the patio considering the weather is so pretty and the staff was attentive and friendly and slightly charming with their loafers and novelty socks (is that part of the required uniform I wonder?)

I'm deducting one star for the sheer fact that this place was filled with rich, middle aged white yuppies talking about golfing and/or glued to their cell phone.  The boyfriend and I, being young dirty Mesa kids still slightly intoxicated off Four Lokos, felt mildly out of place in this setting and were a little over whelmed by the amount of yuppie whiteness.

Nonetheless, the food was worth the trip and the cozy patio on a Sunday morning was a nice change from, you know, Cheerios on the futon while watching exercise equipment infomercials.

It was a very pleasant experience. There was a wait, as expected during the busy hour, but it wasn't very long (10 minutes maximum). Our waitress, Taylor, was extremely nice and answered all our questions thoroughly. They are very on top of things here, including switching out semi-full sugars for full ones and cleaning tables quickly. I ordered the Apple Jack pancake along with a cup of their soup of the day, Potato Corn. The pancakes here are humongous so come with a large appetite if you plan on ordering one! The soup was also very delicious and my mom said it was better than her favourite, Mimi's. We are definitely planning on coming back in the [hopefully near] future.

Since we were in the area, we had to go to T.C. Eggington's for breakfast. I checked other reviews as  the opinions are always interesting.

We arrived here around 10AM on August 18, 2014. This was my second time here and no changes were noted. Service was excellent as everything was addressed in a timely manner.

I ordered the cheese omelette with bacon with English muffin and breakfast type potatoes. My photo of this was taken after I applied ground pepper--not served that way so there's no concern for others. The bacon bits were throughout and on top, very good. My wife odered the scrambled egg special that she enjoyed.

The restrooms were very clean but somewhat hard to find. There's a sign stating "RESTROOMS" but only the ladies room was there. The men's restroom was on the other side of the restaurant. If that's  my only negative issue, it's a nonissue to be sure.

We enjoyed our breakfast and look forward to return for another great meal!
The food was very good, service was prompt and the ambiance was true to the brunch experience. A little more upscale and a great place for a quiet brunch to catch up with a group of friends.

This place means business when it comes to breakfast. The portions are enormous and everything is made using super high quality ingredients. The french toast slicers were as big as my face and the bacon is super thick cut. Any place that serves you see-through floppy meat should not be able to call it bacon!

The service was average but the food is where it's at! There's this awesome apple cinnamon jelly on the table for your biscuits too. Easily my favorite breakfast place. I just wish they were open later because I like breakfast at all times of the day.

I went to TC Eggington's today, and had the Phoenician Chicken Feta Grille, but had it on an onion bun instead of a pita...and OMG is was so good.  The chicken was moist and flavorful, lots of gooey melted cheese, the dipping sauce they gave was to die for.  Nice big piece of watermelon.  They served it with the chef's choice of salad, which was the pasta salad that was drowning in the mayo based dressing.  I didn't eat that.  I would have given it 5 stars if that  pasta salad hadn't been included.  The service was great, ice T glasses kept filled.....you can't miss on this one.  Try it.

As indicated in my previous review this place wasn't high on my list to return to, but we were going right by there and I've never had an issue with the food, so why not.  Well, yet again, the table was sticky.  We watched our server and the owner push two dirty tables together for an 8-top, remove all the dirty plates, glasses, etc, and not wipe the table down.  Then, after the couple next to me left, the server cleaned off the dirty dishes and gave a cursory wipe of one corner with a rag.  The owner comes along to seat the next guests, notices the water ring on the table, wipes his right hand through it, and then spins to shake the hand of the next guest.  

I'm in the dirty table Twilight Zone.

And this time because our server was busy bussing tables, our food came out lukewarm, and Mr. M's yolks were cool and had solidified under the heat lamp.  

Hire.  Some.  Bussers.   

I want to like this place, but now I know the tables are a petri dish.  Good luck.  I will not be back again.

+/- Food 
+ Vanilla Latte 
+ Service 
+ Ambience/Atmosphere 

They have a well oiled machine here, the hosts/hostesses, servers, and busboys were efficient and quick! Came here Sunday morning around 9, a nice little wait (20-30 min) because of the number of people, and possibly because a spring training game later in the afternoon. Pro-tip (something I observed), if the host asks how many people you have and you say 4 adults and one toddler, that's still considered 5 people. Host won't seat you any sooner because your toddler stopped being a person, and you'll waste less time than having a 1-2 minute back and forth with the host about "really just have 4 people and a toddler"; also people behind you won't be as annoyed. But it provided me thorough entertainment. 

So what we are really all here for is the food. I would say solid choice and a large menu of a variety of things to choose from. I ordered a vanilla latte and Eggington omelette, subbing the English muffin for a blueberry English style muffin (25 cents extra if you do this, or so it says on my bill). The vanilla latte was nice and it's something I would order again. I'm not a self proclaimed coffee connoisseur; I'm a Starbucks fan. So if you have a Starbucks palate you'll like the vanilla latte.

On to the food, the omelette was covered in hollandaise sauce with cream cheese sitting on top. I wasn't sure what to do with the cream cheese so I tried to spread it around but ended up putting some on the potatoes, which is an awesome combination by the way. The omelet was stuffed with a lot of broccoli, some large uncooked mushroom, and small amounts of chicken. I might have gotten a fluke because of the rush and the multiple large tables around. I would have preferred the broccoli and mushrooms to be chopped smaller and mushrooms cooked longer. I had a couple raw mushrooms because of the size and I'm personally not a fan of raw mushrooms in cooked/warm food. I enjoyed the omelet even with its pitfalls, but I would like to try something else in the future. I can't provide a review for the muffin because I was too full to even eat it. Ended up taking it to go but it looks and smells delicious. 

Setting is nice, I like decorations, the fresh flowers on the table, and the carafe of water on the table. I think the main selling point was the service. My server was AWESOME, attentive even though he had a large table and many more to attend to, I noticed him running around a lot tending to many tables. Generally single diners are forgotten and left on their own but wow! Everyone was so nice and really did what they could to get the process streamlined with the number of people waiting. 

I enjoyed the food here, and would love to come back to try their other items. I think they need to create a formalized wait list versus having it on multiple legal pads.

Love this place for breakfast, it's the best in town! So easy to make changes to the plated order when I'm counting calories! Love the omelettes, pancakes are fantastic (try the blueberry) the parlour potato's are a favorite of my boyfriends. We try to get there before 9:30 to avoid the wait. They offer coffee if your aren't immediately seated and have a nice area to wait. The staff is super friendly and so on top of service. Nicely dressed wait staff and bussers. Most of all this place delivers artfully assembled food, exceptional service and consistent quality. Yummy!
Shop Local. This place is one of the best local breakfast spots in the East Valley. Great place to cater breakfast food, group meet-ups, 1:1s with clients, or brunch with friends.
TC's isn't a bad spot for breakfast. The pear omlette is my favorite with cottage cheese. Worth a try- plan on a wait.
If you are looking for a place to eat breakfast you should try T.C. Eggington's  they give you big portions and lots of bacon try it I know you will come out very happy

A delight every single time. Wonderful blueberry shakes and breakfast hash browns/potatoes, laid out well on the plate. Pretty big serving sizes too. Complete with fast, courteous service! 

Tucked away in a dying city and a dying strip mall, this place always had customers and sometimes even a short wait.

Oh, and just name an obscure type of egg and you'll get it! :)
Fantastic food and fantastic service. Joseph was an incredible waiter who made sure our large party had everything we needed for a great brunch! Amazing experience!

I love breakfast. If you are a native like me, you know this place well because T.C. Eggington's has been serving the Valley some of the best breakfast since the mid 80's. I think what I really love about T.C. Eggington's is the family feel environment they create in their restaurant. The decor makes you feel at home and the employees work hard to maintain friendly customer service. The food is prepared fresh and the portion sizes are pretty generous. I usually get the eggs benedict but opted instead for their Pumpkin Walnut Pancakes - a Fall favorite of mine. If you are wanting to get in the spirit of Autumn, take a bite of this yummy goodness. I came with a bunch of friends and we had a wonderful experience. You can also check out their sister restaurant Ncounter in Tempe.

I have not been here for over 10 years.  I arrived early knowing this place gets packed.  I am on a trek to find the best Eggs Benedicts in Phoenix so I thought I would order these since a friend posted a pic on FB.  The plate was very attractive and when I tasted the 1st egg benedict, I was almost going to say "never again".  The egg, candaian bacon and english muffin were wonderful but the Hollandaise Sauce was bland (watery).  BUT the 2nd egg benedict had that hollandaise sauce flavor that I so love.  Therefore, I'll be back for more eggs benedict.  I am not sure why 1 was watery and the other was spot on flavorful - but please be sure to tell the cooks that they got it 1/2 right.
Everything else about the place was wonderful - even the crowd coming in were very friendly and spoke to us.  Much appreciated.

Decided to try this breakfast place that actually got good reviews. Was seated right away. Place looked nice, lots of
space and country decor. Tables had carafes of ice water which is nice in AZ. Ordered decaff and o'pear eggwhite omelet. Quick and friendly service. My meal was served with potatoes and English muffin. The omelet was good maybe too much Havarti cheese and the bacon was kinda bland. The pears were tart and my muffin was cold. $13 not bad but shoulda hooked myself up at home! Would give it a other whirl, wasn't terrible but nothing to run back to.
I've been coming here since the late 80s. I love their Crab Stuffed Pastry! It's my favorite!

Really good omelettes for a fair price.

Service was kind of meh.

Now this is definitely a place you have to go for breakfast and brunch! I'm here for business and found this on Yelp as I was looking where to grab some great eggs benedicts. 

And let me tell you, this place treats their eggs B with a lot of love and respect. Probably the second best I've had. Most breakfast place miss the fact that eggs B is all about the hollandaise sauce and the poached eggs. You want to slice and take a bite of that gooiness and they do Eggs B the right way. Also they give you freshly squeezed OJ and not just coming out from a box or bottle. 

You must try this once and you will be coming back again like me!

The food was really great and I enjoyed the rustic theme. I got the omelette with kalamata olives, zucchini, feta and tomato and it was delicious! My boyfriend got the crab pastry and it was delicious but a bit rich with crab, cheese and hollandaise. The potatoes are cooked perfectly! My only criticism is how the wait list is handled. It's all on paper and not very organized. Crowds are standing huddled in the front room and half the people said they called in, and it just seemed a bit hectic with the hostess and all. Apart from that, a great breakfast place!!

I absolutely love this place! The lattes a great, the service is quick and the food is fantastic! Try the white chocolate raspberry latte and the chipotle breakfast burrito. You won't be disappointed!
Great breakfast. Pancakes and French toasts are huge! Just wish they would serve waffles as well.

Food was amazing! I didnt have to wait long for a table and when we were seated we were greeted with a smile and fantastic service. I had the Eggs B. and I love that meal, so having ordered it all over, I am picky, this one was fantastic. 
Go check it out and enjoy

I've been coming here for nearly 20 years with friends for our annual Christmas Eve breakfast. Just fantastic food. Started coming bi-weekly for brunch with my brother, who's an exec chef and says he hasn't found a better breakfast place. Love it. Great prices, very fresh food, and excellent service.

Best omelet ever.  The O'Pear Grenache omelet was incredible, I tasted my companions and was immediately regretting my choice of French Toast.  The French Toast was really good, but didn't compare to that omelet.

The service was incredible.  The place was absolutely packed, but my table of two never lacked for attention.  What we did lack was space!  The table we were at was TINY, our meals and drinks barely fit on the table. The restaurant itself is not large, it is actually quite cramped.  Don't go here if you are bothered by crowds and cramped quarters.  It's also quite loud on weekends, conversation was difficult.

We went on a Saturday around 10am.  We managed to get a table immediately, but it looked like most others had about a 15 minute wait.

This is an excellent breakfast restaurant...also good for lunch.  They have a huge selection of both standard, as well as unique menu items.  My family and friends have been going to TC's for years...I highly recommend it!

This place was recommended by our family in AZ while we were visiting. Positives: food was good, nice portions, waiter checked on us regularly, no wait, no loud kids, friendly staff. Negatives...... nothing really. We didn't have any complaints. Portions were enough that we didn't eat all our food.

I don't live in the Phoenix area but if I did this would be a regular place for me.  We visited T.C. Egginton's (funky name) twice in three days while on vacation.  Good food, friendly staff and a great selection of options to pick from.  Although there is usually a line of people looking to eat the yummy food, the line seems to move quickly due to the many tables.  Looking forward to coming back here on my next trip to the PHX area.
Breakfast was great, quick and the establishment is very clean.  Price is a little high but definitely worth it.

Been here twice--maybe three times? Each was for a nice-ish breakfast and each was solid enough. As the name suggests, they've got plenty of egg dishes on tap for you, with a host of omelets ready to go. I will say that I've yet to be floored by an omelet--I've tried a couple and they all sounded much better on paper, but then when they arrived I wasn't eggspecially wowed. I have no complaints, however, about that actual food and its actual taste. 

I will give a special shoutout to the house jam that's on the table. It's a little bit spiced (not spicy) and complex. Bright, but still a little moody. If you get pancakes, you might forgo the syrup and just slather on the jam. For toast, it's a must.

This is really the perfect place for brunch. They're always hoppin' and the service has always been smooth and polished.
Literally the best omelette I have ever had! Great setting with great staff. I recommend getting the piglet omelette! Delicious.

Always a solid experience here. Really good food, down to earth ambiance and friendly service. They get slammed on holidays, but they manage the crowds extremely well. Lots of breakfast options these days. Bookmark this one for your next east valley getaway.
One year later and we're back! And we knew exactly what we wanted... the crab pastry puffs! All three of us ordered it and it was absolutely fabulous. Did not disappoint!
We love this place. Would recommend making reservations because this place is always busy..... going this Sunday for Father's Day!!!!!

Menu has a wide variety of options and everything that my party ordered was great! I ordered the Apple Jack griddle cakes and they were some of the best pancakes I have ever had in a restaurant. However, I recommend that you share the griddle cakes. They are huge! Also one weird thing; creamer for the coffee was non-dairy creamer. We requested milk. 

I look forward to visiting again.

Definitely a great Sunday brunch spot...the bad part is they usually have an hour wait at 10am when I went. 

The French Toast is the best I ever had...its not Texas sized toast its more like Alaska sized cinnamon toast.

My only real downside from being a 5 star place is a plate of French Toast is filling however i would have probably preffered 2 toast instead of 3 and it comes with a small 2 egg omlette...now that would be a perfect combo.  or even a smaller omlette, a french toast and some bacon or sausage.

They should add those kinds of deals for like 8.99 or 9.99.

Definately better than AZ Bread, Crackers...and the franchises like Good Egg, Denny's, IHOP, Waffle House...

I'm still waiting to try matt's big breakfast...

This has got to be one of the best breakfast restaurants around.  It has continued to serve delicious and out of the usual offerings for at least the last 15 years.  The service is spot on and it is cute.  (Even the bathroom is adorable.)

Most recently I had the eggs benedict with avocado and no meat.  YUM!  Seriously good.  Looking forward to going back sometime soon.

I LOVE breakfast food. I will go all over and try tons of places to find the best and in my opinion this is it. Forget about all these other overpriced fancy breakfast places all over the valley....in my opinion its all overly sweet and makes you feel terrible afterwards. T.C Eggington's is SO good and they have a very normal take on breakfast, but they do it they best way possible.

I love this place for breakfast!  The eggs Benedict is by far the best I have ever had.  Served hot & delicious.  Prepared PERFECTLY every time!!   Our "go to" for a really good meal.  Need to try it for lunch sometime.  The service is outstanding & the owner very friendly.

This place is delicious! It's always crowded, but well worth the wait! Everything on their menu that we have sampled so far is just so good. The crab stuffed pastries, the Apple jack pancakes, the huevos con chorizo, hell even the jam that they have on the side. The service is always on point as well. From the moment you step in your greeted and helped, from there the waiting staff is always attentive.
Awesome breakfast items. Hearty and full of flavor. I love the Big Hot Mama Frittata.
Decent breakfast loaction. The food is always good but the wait is always long. Avoid this place at all costs on a sunday... it's the place to be after church.

This is the best breakfast spot in all the Valley of the Sun. 
We have been coming here for the past 16 years and never had a bad meal or any hiccups with the service.
The owner Tom and manager Evars will go out of their way to accommodate any clients/customers needs or desires.  Management and staff are on the whole the best in the Valley.
There are several dishes that deserve attention.  The waffles are superb, homemade with a little twist, the omelets are to die for, and the service is spectacular.  
THE BEST BREAKFAST & LUNCH RESTAURANT IN ALL OF ARIZONA.

I have eaten here often and the food has been wonderful every time.  The only food I didn't like was something with crab in it.  

The eggs are wonderful, bacon is the best, biscuits and gravy is terrific.  

The service it really good too.

Sitting on the south side of the building is too hot and stuffy for me as there aren't any ceiling fans.  Sitting anywhere else is very comfortable 

This is one of my favorite restaurants.

Great breakfast spot. Only been here once, but definitely ranks as one of the better breakfasts in the Valley.

I had the Eggs Benedict. Good! My dad ordered the ham & eggs. Also good. The coffee was your typical bland "diner" coffee. Not a fan. They should upgrade to a more bold roast.

Overall, we were satisfied though. I'd go back again.

Not impressed...  saw a couple reviews that were not stellar, should have listened!  Pancake was as heavy as the plate it was sitting on & the omelette veggies were supposed to be roasted, nope, raw.  Sorry, 1st & last time I'm here!

NOTE: The restaurant is located right off I-60 on your right hand side, so make sure to turn into that first plaza, so that you don't miss it! 

I came here on a Saturday around 11 am, and a table for 2 was about a 15 minute wait. The restaurant is very cozy and cute, and the staff is great, full of smiles and very nice. My boyfriend and I ordered:

1) Crab Stuffed Pastry Benedict + Potatoes - The core is imitation crab with artichoke hearts on a crispy pastry, almost like a toasted croissant taste. Then, the whole thing is topped by a poached egg and plentiful hollendaise sauce. The sauce is definitely the best part of the dish. I don't care too much for imitation crab, especially if the dish costs ~$12 (quite pricey for imitation, in my opinion). The potatoes were eh. and there wasn't very much of them.

2) Eggs Benedict + Fruit  - DO NOT GET FRUIT as a side, because it literally came 
with 2 pieces of orange and 2 small slices of honeydew. Not much of a fruit salad. This was the standard eggs benedict, poached egg over canadian bacon (which was cooked well), and english muffin. The hollendaise sauce was again the star of the show, and smothered all over the plate (hopefully, you like the sauce as much as I did, otherwise it would be too overwhelming)

3) Side Fruit Salad - grapes, kiwi, apples, honeydew, canteloupe, watermelon - now that's a real side fruit salad.

Overall, the food is okay, but the service is great. I'll probably try an omelette next time.

Had breakfast at TC's this morning and was seated immediately. Very odd considering that it was 10:00 on a Sunday morning and there were a ton of people sitting outside waiting for a table. And no, we did not do call ahead seating either. Felt kinda bad if we did accidentally take someone's table but I was starving and what the heck was I supposed to do?
First thought when sitting down was that the uniforms that the waiters and waitresses had to wear were absolutely ridiculous and unflattering. Waist high mom khaki shorts with pastel polo's and loafers? WTF? The husband and I thought maybe they were going for an Easter theme? I actually felt bad for these poor kids. Yes, I say kids because most of them appears to be in their 20's. I also noticed that none of them were unattractive. I thought the stepford wife description I have seen in several reviews was an exaggeration but I can confirm that it is not. 
I liked that they had a carafe of ice water on the table. Also ordered the pina colada smoothie shoogle. WTF kinda name is that anyways? Well it was decent but there were lots of ice chunks and pineapple at the bottom of the glass that did not get ground up. For my meal, I ordered the farmers market eggs benny with potatoes. It was ok, just mediocre in my opinion. Being that eggs benny is my favorite breakfast, I have eaten a lot of them in my lifetime. This was one just not memorable for me. The eggs were cooked fine and overall, it was ok but the hollandaise was kinda bland not to mention was separating (I could see oil or butter separating from it) and the avocado was a little brown for my liking. The potato's were alright but nothing special. The hubby ordered the spicy Spain omelet with potatoes. The menu clearly states that it is "drenched with salsa and sour cream." Yet, when it arrived, there was no sour cream. I asked the waiter and she stated that that omelet no longer comes with sour cream but she would bring us some at no charge. She later told us that the next time we ordered that omelet, make sure to ask for a side of sour cream. WTF? I guess I am just confused as to why they can't just change the description on their menu? In any event, the hub said his omelet was simply k but didn't have enough filling in it. He also said that by topping the omelet with salsa and cheese and then heating it under the broiler, the salsa had a weird consistency and that he would rather have had the salsa on the side cold instead of warm. To each his own I suppose but the fact that his omelet, like my Benedict, was nothing memorable makes me not want to go out of my way to return here for breakfast. I will say that the apple cinnamon jelly on the table was good for the first few bites but it was a bit too sweet and Cinnamoni for my liking. I also didn't even think of it before but one reviewer had a great point about the "community jelly." Who knows how many nasty little mutants have licked the spoon or used that spoon on an already bitten piece of toast. 
My final thoughts: As stated before, I would not go out of my way to return. However, if someone else wanted to go or we were in the area, I wouldn't put up a fight to try it again. I would probably order the crab pastry benny next time and see if that is decent although with my meal today, I don't hold high hopes.

PS: I noticed that there were doors separating the rooms so this may be a decent spot to go if you were having a large breakfast party or meeting
Really enjoyable breakfast with a solid selection of options that are locally produced. Coffee was excellent. Staff was friendly and attentive. Quick service.

Highly disappointed with the service. Luckily found out that they serve brown water for coffee as they serve it out front while you wait so didn't order it inside. I've had better coffee at gas stations, sadly.  My daughters poached egg came out nearly raw & when I kindly asked the waiter to have the kitchen cook it through, he acted like "of course, no problem" but then 10 mins later brought us an equally-- if not more-- raw egg. As a former server, I would have been embarrassed to serve it-- I mean the yolk was completely yellow, it wasn't a subtle thing. .  When my husband pointed out-- again, that the egg looked just as raw, & asked for a fully cooked egg,  the waiter stated arrogantly, "Well, *That's* a poached egg".  We don't work at a breakfast place, but my husband & I have both worked in nice restaurants. If there is a standard as to how poached eggs are cooked, that should have been explained either at the time of ordering, or at least after it was sent back the first time. We gladly would have changed the order to an over hard egg if the chef was too arrogant to fully cook a poached egg.  After the egg went back the 2nd time, it took at least 15 minutes for it to come back. Everyone else in our party of 8 was done eating and I asked the waiter to just box it up, at this point it was clear I was upset.  

Some restaurants send a manager over at the first sign of trouble. Most would certainly do it after the 2nd time an order gets returned to the kitchen.  Even after I was clearly upset (& yes, he knew, cause he tried not to hand the check to me & I could see his dismay when I took it) no manager came to rectify the situation and we had to pay for a meal that was never eaten   (we took it home out of principal, but I doubt at this point it will get eaten..)   I really should have asked to see a manager, but I didn't want to make our guests more uncomfortable, which is why most restaurants take the burden off the customer & automatically have mgr's come to talk to a table when there has been a problem. It is rare that I take grievances out on a servers tip, being a former server myself, but he was so clearly apathetic to the situation that I left him slightly less than 15% when I am normally a 20-25% tipper. You would think that after spending nearly $100 on breakfast (we were ordering mimosas and bloody Mary's etc...) the server would have cared a little more about his service. I guess TC Eggingtons rely's on their long standing rep but with service this bad, that balloon will eventually pop.
Lived up to the hype. The spicy Spain was delicious. As was the oj..very cozy spot with reasonable prices. Will go again

We are in town on business and stopped in mainly based on its location to where we were. And Oh My God! The food was so good. We both had omelets and both marveled on how fresh the potatoes were and how well the omelets were made. Everything tasted so fresh! I loved the decor from the bare bulbs with the long filaments to the deep sinks in the bathroom. This place takes you to a distance place and time where the people are polite and the food is fresh. I wouldn't doubt this place is hopping on Saturday and Sunday mornings, so I would seriously consider making a reservation.

It breaks my heart to visit a place help up with such high reviews be such a disappointment, I stopped in for a nice breakfast with my team before a meeting and was 110% disappointed with just about everything. We were seated right away which was great but that was just about the only good thing, if I where to recommend anything here it would be the orange juice and the water the food took almost 40 minutes and was only brought to us when we inquired about it only after the server gave us an attitude as if we were a burden. When we finally received our food it wasn't made properly we had half cold half warm food not even hot it was slightly warm.... When asked by owner how our experience was he became very hostile and incredibly rude because we didn't sugar coat the awful service. I'm having an incredibly hard time understanding how they have attained such high reviews

Yum-O! I had the Eggs Ben E Dict, they were excellent! My wife had the Spicy Spain omelette, which was also very good. The side potatoes are delicious. Good coffee, good food, good service and very nice and clean dining room. This will be a regular weekend (too far away from us for the weekday, but worth the drive on a Sunday morning) breakfast stop for us!

2 stars because the food was good but the service was a different experience all together. We visited on a Sunday morning when it was very busy. The manager was like Henny Penny and didn't know what to do, he was trying to get his young staff to hussle in a very paniced way. I witnessed them trying to seat a handicapped woman at a table that required climbing stairs to get to? Come hear if you're type A and like to panic while you eat. Crackers and the Farmhouse are far superior in food and service.

Got their Eggington Omelette. Good quality eggs, and I'm definitely a fan of their chicken and broccoli. A little too heavy and rich on their hollandaise sauce. The fruit that came on the side was a nice extra!

Went here for Mother's Day. They did a great job. Hostess was nice, server was quick and pleasant and the food was great. My son got some kind of fancy breakfast burrito with avocado in it that was amazing. I know, avocado in a breakfast burrito. Sounds gross but it wasn't. Biscuits and gravy tasted homemade  and the French toast was very good. I wish this place was across the street from my house, I would go every day!!

The menu has a picture of a rather large boy, Bob Eggington, in overalls with a caption stating: "Bob was the strongest boy with the heartiest appetite, always eager to make the pancakes. Always." If I ever have a kid (god forbid), I want him to be like Bob and make me some damn pancakes. ALWAYS. 

On a more serious note, Eggingtons has some intense egg dishes. I'm normally not a big fan of breakfast places since I believe you can eat such a meal much more cheaply at home and it will be just as good. Eggington moves past this dilemma by offering up some delicious egg creations. I ordered the Piglet's Passion, an omelette containing a variety of vegetables but, more importantly, bacon, ham, and sausage with assorted cheese. Did I mention it was topped with sour cream? My heart strains to pump blood through my arteries ever since. Served with potatoes and an english muffin, this place offers up some manly breakfasts. 

The other items also appear to be based on a decent premise: assloads of meat, cheese, or vegetables served with eggs in a variety of forms. I have but one grievance: the lack of low priced options. I understand why an omlette with veggies, cheese, and three types of meat will run $8.95, but it would be nice to see some other tasty, but less expensive offerings on the menu.

Good unknown breakfast spot.  If I am ever in the area and it's remotely near breakfast time, I stop here to eat. 

There isn't anything bad on the menu breakfast related.  The service is decent.  The atmosphere is laid back and it's just relaxing.

The average age here is probably 60, but that's part of the charm.  You can just enjoy breakfast and have some peace and quiet.

This is, hands down, the best breakfast spot in the area. I highly recommend the Croque Monsieur. But everything there is top notch. I also appreciate the fact you can call ahead and make a reservation or get on the waitlist, because my father, who is elderly, is unable to stand for long periods of time so we don't generally wait at restaurants

Simply the best breakfast place in Mesa. Hands down no competition game over don't even try another place. Also just watching the owner work is a life lesson for all ages. The food is prime. In other words of the highest quality. The service is 8 out of ten stars. Needs a little polishing. But they are busy all of the time. It's not because they are busy talking about how drunk they got last night. I recommend getting the HULK to start off your morning right. Then I love there spicy Spain. I've eaten here since I was a child. I'm now 38. The quality has never gone down. I've seen them stub their toe. However never seen them crash. That's a rare thing to say about a restaurant   I've been to over a 100 times in my LIFE.

The in-laws took me as this morning as a belated birthday meal.  They usually go to Crackers but I found this place under one site's best breakfast, and it got pretty good reviews on Yelp so figured why not.
We went at 930 and they were busy but not busy enough for a wait...it was like people were still sitting from earlier.  The hosts seemed like a fake nice and when the bro-in-law and his girlfriend showed up, they didn't bother to bring them menus.  Never even caught the server's name but she seemed nice enough.  Two of the glasses on the table were dirty and when I handed them to her, she didn't bring new ones. It also has bad acoustics or something since it is kinda loud in the place, I kept having to have people repeat themselves. 
I specifically picked a place that made eggs benedict because it is my favorite breakfast meal.  The hollandaise sauce was really good but one egg was overcooked since the yolk wouldn't run and the other was slightly underdone because the whites were a little jiggly.  I do really like how the pancakes are huge, my daughter should have only gotten one, and how they leave carafes of water and my tea on the table so you don' t have to wait for a server to refill.  We will definitely try this place again.  This visit was more like a 3.5 instead of 4

I just happened to pass by this place on my way to the airport and I was SO pleased by this breakfast spot! The place was packed on a Tuesday morning but I was sat right away. Vases of water are already at each table which was lovely. I ordered the Roasted Tuscan omelet and HOLY COW, it was the most amazing thing I have ever tasted on the egg front. I'm an eggs benedict type of girl so I kinda felt guilty going to the omelet side, but the fresh ingredients in this particular dish had me completely sold. Add some fresh coffee, bacon and fruit and I was in breakfast heaven. I even went to the grocery store today to buy some sundried tomatoes, basil and feta to recreate this dish. Loved it! Hope to go back next time I'm in Mesa.

It was my first time dinning here. Very warm atmosphere. The staff is friendly and we were allowed to take our time deciding on what to order. The food and coffee was delicious. Will definitely be coming back.

Worst experience ever here.  Not normal but they didn't seem to care either.  It took over 40 minutes to get food once ordered.  I asked her if it would be out soon and she got annoyed and said there were 2 large parties in the other room.  I get the kitchen getting backed up but that is no excuse for attitude and poor service.  We had to ask 3 times for refills and remind her several times for creamer.  Too far to drive for such a disappointing experience.  
Funny thing about customer service... its the only real differentiator and if you get annoyed with your customers and do nothing about it....the problem will go away.  :/

Car club was there for lunch today after we all did some volunteer work. Many had been there before and they all raved about the place and the food. Very nice place, open and airy, large with some outdoor areas. They did accommodate our crowd of about 14. The menu is extensive, with breakfast, brunch and lunch. Not sure if they serve dinner as it was not on the menu or maybe that is the menu throughout the day. Orders from our diners were all over the place from breakfast to lunch items. All the sandwiches looked very good and those biting into them all said they were indeed good. I had a chop salad. It was just the right size, not too much, not too little, nice mix of ingredients including corn which added a nice crunch. It was chopped nicely for eating with a fork. But, the best part of it was the pesto dressing, it was delicious. While others took away some of their food, I ate mine all up with glee. I would give them a 5 star review but I am trying to be more judicious in giving out top awards. I would recommend T C Eggingtons and also must say that the crowd today around noon was certainly a senior citizen one.....not sure, maybe it was coupon day. But, try it, I think you will like it.

After reading the glowing reviews here on yelp my gf and i tried this place out this morning. The result was not what we were hoping for.

I was deciding between a couple things for breakfast and when i asked the waitress for a recommendation she didn't hesitate to say the Eggs Benedict, which is a favorite of mine so I ordered it. My gf ordered the blueberry griddle cake (read:over sized pancake). I also got a jumbo OJ and she got a rasberry chocolate latte that was a special for the day.

Had we only ordered drinks this place would have been 4 star. The OJ was nice and fresh with great taste and the latte was very good with not too sweet a rasberry taste and better than anything at starbucks for less money.

Then the food came and things went downhill. My eggs were prepared fine but somebody forgot to add any flavor beyond the smoked flavor in the ham. The hollandaise was bland, the eggs were nothing special, the standout was the potatoes but even they weren't much beyond you average ihop country potatoes. I added pepper and tobacco after the first few bites but it didn't help give any real flavor.

Sharon said the pancakes were bland as well and lacking flavor as well and only ate half based on how much there was and how she got tired of them after awhile.

The price wasn't bad and the service was only fair. It cost $30 after tip for all the food so not bad about the same as ihop but flavor didn't make it worth it. The service was fine with the exception that we called for a reservation based on some recommendations and we arrived they didn't have us on the list but we were still seated promptly. The server was helpful and promot and it was a nice touch the way they were all dressed in chino shorts and button up shirts, felt like a nice east coast yacht club.

5 stars all the way for this place. It was Fathers Day and pretty busy but we still managed to be seated in about 10 minutes. I was a little surprised by the veggie heavy menu, but everything was so good. I had the Eggington omelette with potatoes and their homemade English muffins. Everything was SO good. Even my Bloody Mary was thick and spicy. Our server was absolutely top-notch as well.

Oh, this was not good. Food not tasty. Overpriced not tasty food. If you're going to pay for a crab benedict, it should remotely taste like crab. And not be cold. Too busy, too long of a wait, too hungry to change. Other items tasted at our table did not receive much better feedback. I can't recall what others ate. In fact, there wasn't much worth remembering.

Best most fresh eggs benedict I have ever had in my life and I've had many. The sauce was not to thick, not too thin, not to strong.  It was perfect!  The two other people who dined with me each said it was the best omelette's they have ever had as well. They actually make their own english style muffin for the benedict so it was so fresh and tender.  They even had their own gluten free delicious bread for one of us who can not eat gluten at all.  He said it was delicious.  I'll definitely be back to his gem of a restaurant.
A solid breakfast nook serving all of the standard fare, but in incredibly large portions.  On the plus side, this will be the only meal you'll need all day.

The wait for two people was about a half an hour. They had coffee labled water containers out front for people to stay hydrated which I guess the thought is what counts, but to my boyfriend's disappointment it was not actually coffee. It's a small quaint 'family-owner' styled restaurant. It was fairly neat and clean. However, they need a course for their wait staff to learn what constitutes unmotivated service to excellent service. They need two bussers just to clean off one table fast enough. The waiters all seem to go at their own morning pace and the professionality just is not there (yet they have potential). I feel that there is great possibilities for this place to become a staple in the east side of towns must-have breakfast locations.

***Their dishes taste delicious and homely-authentic. Truly wonderfully made food.***

The only suggestion I would have is reduce some of the portions down because it really is a lot to try to take in. (And people wonder why on the average, Americans are overweight)

Three eggs, over easy and a side of bacon; perfect!
The staff at TC Eggingtons know how to make breakfast right, and I'll invite ALL of my acquaintances to come and have breakfast with me here ;)

O. M. G. I fancy myself a breakfast aficionado, and this place blows all my other other fave breakfast places away! Unbelievably, there was not a very long wait to get seated, and absolutely everything we tried was amazing and tasted homemade. Service was impeccable - they even sent us away with some of their best homemade muffins, on the house!! Breakfast doesn't get better than this!!
T.C. Egging tons is the place to go for breakfast , brunch , lunch ! Get here early because they get packed quick ! I love the "Eggs Ben. E Dict" so good !

Quite frankly, there isn't a better breakfast in America (don't tell my wife). Although TC Eggintons is a bit expensive and always crowded, the breakfast food is second to none.

I am personally a fan of the french toast but pretty much everything on the menu is divine. 

Since breakfast is the most important meal of the day, I would start it off here.

Pretty good breakfast! I'd say 3.5 stars.

TC's has big portions and fair service. We were seated right away on a Saturday morning, so that was nice!

We ordered the super thick gi-hugeous french toast, be sure to poke holes in it with your fork and drench it with syrup --- otherwise it could be a bit dry. But it was very fluffy and delicious, we couldn't finish it all.

We also had the Santa Fe Sautee (with basted eggs) and the pear, almond, and bacon omelette (the O'Pear). These were both yummy, though the O'Pear was a bit disjointed in terms of taste. I liked it, but didn't LOVE it.

Overall it's a good place to take out-of-town friends and family.

The food was delicious, the service was phenomenal. We got the Tuscan omelette, blueberry pancakes, and apple jack griddles. The blueberry pancakes needed to be dipped in syrup, but the omelette and griddles were great! Our waiter, Skylar was amazing! He was cheerful, helpful, and very accommodating. The atmosphere was rustic and comfortable. I will definitely be going back.

We were in the PHX area and and my friend Douglas invited us to check out his home.  We were meeting in the morning and he suggested we have breakfast and that he had a good place to meet.  We were not sure what to expect...Dennys or something but when he told us where we were pleasantly surprised.  

The food we had was very good.  The wife and I shared a Santa Fe scramble and French Toast.  Both were very good.  The Cinnamon bread was thick and very good and fresh and the skillet was a good spicy.    As he mentioned to his wife we were plate cleaners and must have liked the place.  

It was clean and nicely decorated and like the old-time light bulbs.

I would definitely go back the next time we are in the PHX area.

WARNING: I really enjoy puns. They crack me up. 

I would like to eggs-press how pleasantly surprised I was with my egg-cellent eggs-perience at T.C. Eggington's. The waitstaff is egg-spectionally delightful and the atmosphere is cozy. Egg-spect to see long lines of egg-cited people during the weekend waiting to get in on the egg-stravaganza but the line moves pretty fast so no need to get over easy about it.

Make no yokes about it, these cooks are eggs-perts because the food is absolutely egg-strodinary! I've tried scrambled eggs to omelettes. At T.C. Eggington's they will make it eggs-actly your way. No eggs-ageration! Even if you want one of their sandwich combinations in an omelette - they will go the eggs-tra mile to make it happen. 

The O'pear and Eggington's omelette are the most popular items on the menu for a reason - they are an eggs-polsion of flavor in your mouth. The apple cinnamon jelly is also too good to egg-nore. It is available on all the tables so I'm b-eggin' you to try it on your English muffin that comes with most of the meals.

Drinks are only $5 so you have no egg-cuse not to try a Bloody Mary or a Mimosa unless you are egg-specting a little one. 

I'm a little eggs-austed now but I finally have the satisfaction of feeling like Vincent Price in an old school Batman episode. No need to continue egggin' me on, I know when it is time for me to egg-zit! But if you want a breakfast or brunch egg-cursion that leaves you sunny side up then go to T.C. Eggington's.

That's all yokes!

I found this place on someone's blog I found via Pinterest. As it happened, it was right by our hotel. My husband had the Huevos con Chorizo which is served skillet style and I had the Piglet's Passion omelette which was fantastic. Often times, when there is a lot of filling, you lose the egg quality. It becomes thin and not fluffy. Well not here. It was probably one of the best I've ever had. There are so many other choices I'm looking forward to trying when we move there! Yep, I'll be back!

TC Eggingtons is so Delish!! I go here for breakfast at least once every time I'm in Arizona. 
Where do I begin.. The apple jelly, the fresh orange juice, the giant blueberry pancake, and the most amazing omelette/frittata selection you can possible imagine. I highly suggest going with a group so you can sample eachothers food and split the blueberry hill pancake.

This place is great. The staff is so friendly and efficient despite it always being crazy busy. I love all of the choices for breakfast and can't get enough of the 5 dollar mimosas. I think this is my new Sunday spot.

I have been coming here for years and never a bad meal. The staff is always dressed professionally, its always clean and I love the decor since they remodeled. Its one of the few places my kids will eat every bite of food on their plate. The french toast and greek fetish are my two favorites.

Ok... I feel kinda bad about giving this place a bad review because it seems like a lot of people like it. Here's my take: It's like a bad Mimi's Cafe with it's 1980s country decor, fresh scrubbed servers in preppy polo shirts and khakis. Packed with grandparently-types and baby shower goers, my first reaction was, "I don't want to eat here!" But I held judgment until I tried the food. 

Our server was very nice, but wasn't really around much to take care of things - like the check. The busboy was busy checking his iPhone behind the wall. 

I got the eggs Benedict and the eggs weren't poached - maybe they were, but they were, but not in any way I've seen eggs properly poached. That's besides the point. The main concern was that they were very runny and the "hollandaise" sauce that drenched the plate tasted like raw, warm egg yolk, thereby soaking and making the English muffin a soggy mess under pink, falsely-ripened tomatoes. So sad... I picked off the avocado and eggs and let the rest of the dish sort of ooze all over my plate until our server appeared to ask if I was done. Indeed, I was. sigh.

My partner got the fritatta, which was more of an egg white omelette with cheese on top. Decidedly flavorless and bland. 

If you're all about paying for average food, you'll love this place. Me? Okay, fine. I'm a food snob. I'll own that.

This place is amazing! It really left an impression on me. When we walked inside we were so disappointed we were getting our order to go. They have water pitchers and fresh flowers at EVERY table. Every table is set.  Don't even get me started on the food. My boyfriend got the the Cottage Reef omelette and I couldn't stop eating it. It has crab meat and hollandaise. It's like an explosion of flavor. Neither of us like artichokes but we ate all the artichokes in that omelette! The pancakes are HUGE and they put a giant mound of WHOLE fresh strawberries on top. Not slices. Not halves. WHOLE strawberries. You really get your money's worth here. Customer service is similarly outstanding. It makes me so sad that I live in another state now as I am longing to go back!

Ate here with my mom, whom I was visiting.  We had a yummy, yummy breakfast.  I had an omelette with so much goodness: bacon, ham, olives, mushrooms, onions, black olives and sour cream.  Not only was everyone there polite and cheery- our waitress brought me a cup of coffee to go as we didn't finish the carafe on the table!  Loved it!

This was my first visit for breakfast and I will definitely be coming back.  I had the Crack O' Dawn, which was a potato skillet with diced ham, fresh mushrooms, onions and melted cheese with two eggs on top.  It also came with an english muffin.  The potatoes were cooked perfectly and the dish had good chunks of ham.  It was excellent!  They also had homemade cinnamon/apple jam on the table to use, which I did, and it was also delicious.

My girlfriend had the Hilltop Acres, which was also a potato skillet with more vegetables than mine, but minus the ham.  She loved the flavor and the potatoes.  However, even though she is a cheese lover, she thought it was a little too much.  I noticed our neighbors ordered the french toast and that looked incredible.  

Service was great, staff was attractive, and will be going back soon to try the french toast.

Good place!  We didn't wait long at all for a table.  Polite young staff that are well dressed.  Food came out very quick and was tasty.  Our only "complaint" is that my boyfriend's English muffin was cold but he wasn't going to eat it anyways.  Definitely recommend.

this place was just ok.  I don't really get all the hype around it but wonder if there are few places for breakfast to choose from in the Mesa area.  The potatoes tasted out of the bag (frozen) and I asked for a fruit cup and the kiwi was sliced but still had the skin on it...really guys?

Great breakfast and lunch options. Love the eggs Benedict here, made with real hollandaise sauce not cheese sauce some places use. They're small juices are very small but luckily ever table has it's own carafe of lemon ice water if you're a big drinker like me. Be prepared to wait if you show up on a weekend morning, good breakfast places always have a line.

Opear omelet was a nice creamy, sweet bacony blend on freshness... huge fan of the havarti cheese.... give u a full coffee pot for yourself and huge water pitcher so your not constantly waiting on refills... the English muffin and homemade jam was scrumptious and last but certainly not least.. the potatoes was perfectly cooked... would recommend
One of the very best places to grab some tasty breakfast. Quick and very friendly staff. Tried almost complete menu, and haven't found anything I wouldn't try again.

Imagine...you walk into a restaurant.  All the waitstaff is dressed like they belong in the fifties with collared shirts, long khaki shorts, colored socks and loafers.  How could it get better than that?  

Well, it does.  The skillets are the best I have ever had.  This whole in the wall, strip center joint is my favorite brunch place...and on the weekends, prepare to wait.  I have dined at the celebrity infused bruncheries in NYC, all the brunch places I can find in Dallas, but still no one can match the Eggington cajun potatoes.  They are perfectly crispy and have a little kick.  I have heard great things about the sandwiches and soups, but I always opt for breakfast when I am in the Valley.

This place was AMAZING. First, we were seated within 30 seconds of walking in the door at brunchtime on a Sunday. Our server, Valdie, was fabulous. She helped us to pick out the best menu items for what we were looking for. The meal was huge, especially for what we paid. The only regret I have is being uncomfortably full from eating too much delicious breakfast food and that I had to pick only one of the great menu options.
This place has both good service and very good food. The eggs Benedict is my favorite and the portions are large. Decently priced and good parking.

This is my family's favorite breakfast/brunch restaurant. The food is "eggcellent" and the service is fantastic. When there's a birthday meal to be had our daughters always ask to go to TC's. The atmosphere is very casual and the servers do a great job of helping us celebrate. You should give it a try, most likely you'll be back soon to share your experience with someone else!

I've had this place on my radar for awhile now, having checked out their menu online, I was wanting to try the pear omelet.  A friend and I stopped in after the National Kidney Foundation Walk and I expected for a late Saturday morning to find a line and a long wait.  I was surprised when we were seated immediately.  The atmosphere was like being in someone's home, very homey and comfortable.  I must say though, I was a little grossed out by the thick gray carpeting, it just looked dirty and and didn't feel very sanitary to me.

My friend and I both ordered the pear omelet and it was good, not great.  Needed more pears in it if you're going to name the dish after them.  We noticed what others were eating and I must say I'd probably come back to try the fantastic looking french toast!  

All in all I thought our experience was just average, nothing really stood out as being all that good or bad.

this is prob the only az breakfast eatery that the husband and i have frequented numerous times over the years. we've always had good service and great food here. the only downside (for me) is the odd down-home americana decor. i could do without it.

my fave is the eggington omelette. SO GOOOOOD! and the red hot mama. love the spice. husband enjoys the pig omelette and other meaty spicy goodness. 
the only thing i've been underwhelmed with is the O'pear. It is unique and not terrible, just not my personal favorite combo of flavors. 

LOVE the pastel polos (not so much the pleated khaki shorts) that all of the workers wear!

I've been here a handful of times -- and need to go back for at least two more handfuls to try all the delicious things on their menu!  I'd advise going during the week, if possible.  On weekends the wait can be 30-40 minutes (long by Arizona standards).  

Past choices included the crab and artichoke omelet, the crab topped pastry with poached egg, or French toast made with cinnamon bread, then dipped in a custard-like batter.  This past visit I had the Farmer's style Eggs Benedict that piled tomato, spinach, and avocado on an English muffin, then a poached egg and Hollandaise sauce.  Scrumptious!  The only thing I don't think I'd order again are the smoothies.  My adult son agreed -- healthy, but not all that flavorful.  

Nice touches at this restaurant.  Tables are set up with a carafe of water.  The menus have actual chicken wire sealed into the front cover.  This theme is carried through on the lamps.  

Although they are known for breakfast, the lunch menu looked tantalizing, too.  Definitely a place to put on the favorites list!
Went there this afternoon for a business lunch meeting and will definitely be going back. The food was fresh, light, and delicious.

I love this place. It was one of the first breakfast places I went to when I moved here. Their pancakes are huge and very good. I always get the chocolate milk...the whipped cream is amazing. I LOVE the omelette with crab and cream cheese..ooooh it's so yummy! The service is always good, we have never had any issues. It is always packed in the mornings and for good reason. I will keep coming back.

We found this place about a year ago and go at least once a month. Their menu is fantastic. Everything we have tried is sooo good. My favorite is the Farmers Market Benedict. Although the French Toast is to die for. Definitely check this place out!
My favorite place to go in Arizona for breakfast wish they would open one out here in California

Today was the first day I've been to this restaurant. A couple of my friends and I stopped in for breakfast. Probably one of the best eggs Benedict plates I've ever had. Our server was very kind and did a wonderful job. I would recommend this food to both varieties of guests, those looking for a healthy light meal (they offer gluten free) as well as those looking for the delicious desert style waffles. Wish I could add another star!!

My wife and I and two others ate here yesterday morning Dec. 26th, It was
wonderful, the restaurant was very charming in decor and the food
came out hot, fresh and very delicious. Our waiter was very good as well.
Kept our drink full and was helpful to a few of us that have never been here
on what to order. All 4 of loved the food.

You can never go wrong with Anything you order on the menu!! Everything is delicious!! TC's has become a ritual for my girlfriends and I to go to for Sunday breakfast. We always have great service and food.

Lackluster, flavorless breakfast. Do not go out of your way to come here. I was shocked at how many people were waiting to eat here. I ordered the poached eggs with toast and potatoes. They overcooked the eggs; a place with the word EGG in the title should be able to properly poach an egg. The potatoes were very basic and sad. The bacon my dad ordered was fatty and kinda undercooked. The big killer is that the prices were more expensive than a diner yet the quality of the food was the same.

BACKGROUND 

I just had the pleasure of eating at T.C. Eggington's on Alma School in Mesa. 

T.C. EGGINGTON'S

T.C. Eggington's has been serving breakfast, lunch and brunch since 1985. It is a family owned restaurant that has won many awards for their homemade traditional recipes. 

THE STORY 

I saw a picture of their Foster French on Yelp this morning and couldn't wait to try it for myself.

When I got there, I was very pleased that they had plenty of parking out front. 

Walking in, I immediately noticed how clean and adorable the restaurant was. The decor made me feel like I was going over to Grandma's for breakfast. 

SERVICE EXPERIENCE 

The host was extremely helpful and considerate and the waiter was efficient and very polite.

I ordered the Foster French and it looked exactly like advertised and it was super delicious!

Breakfast was very reasonable, around $10 for one person, not including tip.

THE MENU

The breakfast menu also includes:
Fresh Baked English Muffins
Breakfast Salad
Oatmeal
Omelettes 
Parlour Creations
Frittatas
Girdle Cakes:
Plain, Honey Roasted Wheat Germ,
Cobbler-Stone Trail, Apple Jack, Blueberry

CONCLUSION 

5/5 RECOMMEND 

OF NOTE

*Hours: 6:30am - 2:30pm Daily

*For more information:
tcegg.com

Had breakfast here with the parental units the other day.  Called ahead seating at 8:30 to be there at 10:30.  Good idea because it was very busy when we got there.  We waited about 5 minutes for our table.  The place is bigger than it looks and there is a whole parking lot for parking.  Although there wasn't enough handicap parking for my dad's taste.  

The menus have a huge variety of breakfast and lunch items, including vegetarian fare.  The cover of the menu has a piece of chicken wire under the plastic that I thought was particularly clever. 

We ordered coffee all around, and it was hot and tasty.  i had the Farmer's Market Eggs Benedict which added sliced tomato, avacado and sauteed spinach to the traditional dish.  it was soooooo good, I wanted to scream it from the mountain tops!  I kept saying, "mmmm.   mmmm." as I chewed away in heavenly delight.

M had chorizo and eggs and he ate about 3/4 of the huge plate.  Mom had an egg beater omelette, but it was covered in too much cheese, she only ate about 1/4 and felt ill.  Too heavy for her taste.  Dad had the wheat germ pancakes (he actually ordered the "germ pancakes") we all laughed.  they were sooooo good, I wanted to shout some more.  They were warm and soft and chewy and nutty and sweet.  OMG!  They didn't even need any syrup, although dad got sugarfree syrup that was awfully sweet anyway.  They came in a serving of 2.  I, personally, would have added bacon with them to get the salty/ sweet action going.

Breakfast and coffee all around cost us $47.  A little pricey, but the food was really good.  I would come back here in a heart beat.

Wonderful example of having a truly delicious fresh homemade meal, except your not at home. You're  at T.C. Eggington's!

Our Sunday Brunch roost was made special from beginning to end. Too warm a day to sit the the patio, we opted for their indoor seating. Although busy, they sat us down immediately. Happy happy!

Mimosa's on the menu made me happier therefore we started with those. 
Miss Kelly was delightful and patiently helped with menu questions. Great,  because they have a marvelous variety of food choices and a few are ever so slightly different. But still different.

We ordered 3 main dishes being: Crab Puff, Eggs Benedict, and Piglet's dish. Additionally ordered the Plain Pancakes and a side order of bacon to share (with our table) 
Easy to understand why this place rocks! Everything came out just made, piping hot and tasted very fresh indeed. We ate in total comfort and friendly warmth service this restaurant exudes. 
One impressionable feature for me was the Coffee Flask left at the table for us to refill our... Coffee! We love having a hot full cup while eating breakfast and therefore with that result, sealed this 5 star deal!

Went here on vacation and used yelp to find a healthy breakfast. Went there on a Monday morning and there was no wait. Really nice decor, with a cold pitcher of ice water on the table. The menu is so cute and unique with chicken wire on it! I had the Greek omelet and it was delish. The potatoes are nice and crispy and not greasy!! Food was a little slow coming out but worth the wait. It has unique omelet and egg selection that I think will please everyone. I will note that like other reviews I did feel under dressed...

Haven't been here for a while. Thought we would try on a Friday versus a busy Saturday or Sunday. Guess I was wrong. Didn't look that busy. We ordered and really didn't notice how long it was taking for our food, but then everyone else was getting there's and we weren't. Waiter was no where to be seen. Finally a manager I presume came over and said sorry our ticket got lost in the grill or something like that. Finally got our food. The food was great. Service not so much. The waiter should have been more attentive and let us know before the manager had to step in. I am used to if something happens you comp something or do something extra to get us to come back. Not here.I guess saying sorry was enough. Oh well.Bye Bye Felicia.

We never go to breakfast, but glad we did.  Happen to be in the area and great place.  Good portions, good value.  Had the breakfast Chorizo and was really really good.  If it was a bit closer to home would definitely go back.  If I'm in the area, we will be going back!

Quite lovely place to have Breakfast/Brunch. The ambiance was warm and fairly quiet. The food was wonderful! They have a great menu with lots of options depending on what you like, should be something for anyone, including the kids. I can also speak very highly of our service, as our server Alex very graciously discussed some of her recommendations with us. Great experience overall! We will be back, maybe tomorrow!

This place is busy! That alone speaks for itself. I made a healthy choice which doesn't always equate to tasty, but that's not the case here. I had a very tasty breakfast! I would bring out of town guests here for an affordable and delicious breakfast. The menu is extensive. The decor is welcoming. The staff handled the mass of people with care and ease. I'll be back.

I was in Arizona for Spring Training recently and had a chance to try some breakfast at T.C. Eggington's.  The omelet was delicious; the cheese and vegetables were mixed perfectly with the fluffy eggs. 

I was also impressed by the homefries.   Though there wasn't any particularly unique seasoning, the homefries were technically sound with each potato crisp on the outside and soft on the inside.

I've always loved this place, been coming here for many years and I get the same thing - French toast or Eggington Omlet. There is usually a 15-30 minute wait because they are a popular place but once you're at the table service is quick! The people here are nice and the food is the best!!

This was a wonderful experience.  Our service was stellar. The waitress was friendly and helpful - she shared recommendations of her favorite dishes and was there when we needed something.  We all had omelettes.  Two Mediterranean Omelettes,  one Crab and Artichoke, and the fourth was Eggington's Omlette with ham, tomatoes, Swiss cheese and Hollandaise. They were each delightful. Our friends said they were the best omelettes they had ever eaten.  Can't ask for better than that!
The staff was very friendly and polite and the food was absolutely excellent! Despite the 35 minute wait it was well worth it and we will definitely be back again!
